Chapter 1

The flames in the fireplace were nearly extinguished , the curtains drawn on the high windows of [[Elijah Crane]40-eli ’s office]226-his office . Rain pattered on the glass , providing a soothing backdrop for [his]40-eli work . [He]40-eli pecked at [his]40-eli keyboard , [his]40-eli mind on the e - mail , when a mousy , quiet voice lifted in the darkness .

“ [Mr. … Crane]41-reese ? ”[40-eli]

The desk lamp and a slice of natural light made its way past the doorless entry to [[his]40-eli office]226-his office . [[His]40-eli newest temporary assistant]227-your brother stood blocking that light , [her]227-your brother shadow a long , narrow wedge .

“ [Reese Crane]41-reese called , ”[227-your brother] [she]227-your brother said as [she]227-your brother walked into [[his]40-eli office]226-his office . “ [[Your]40-eli brother]227-your brother . ”[227-your brother]

Like [he]227-your brother needed that clarification ?

“ [I]227-your brother know who [Reese Crane]41-reese is , [Melanie]42-melanie . ”[227-your brother]

“ [He]41-reese asked [me]227-your brother to … ”[227-your brother] [Her]227-your brother small voice grew smaller until it vanished altogether . Reason being , [Eli]40-eli had taken a deep , rumbling breath and pushed [himself]40-eli up from the desk .

Slowly .

Let it never be said intimidation was n’t an art form .

[He]40-eli kept [his]40-eli eyes on [the woman]228-merina now standing at the other side of [his]40-eli desk . [She]228-merina was young , in [her]228-merina early twenties , and from what [he]40-eli ’d gleaned in the last eight or so hours since [she]228-merina ’d started this position , weak . [He]40-eli ’d bet [he]40-eli could run this one off in record time . Not that [he]40-eli was keeping track , but maybe [he]40-eli should . [He]40-eli was getting good at it .

[He]40-eli blew out that same breath , keeping [his]40-eli lip curled , [his]40-eli expression hard . [He]40-eli let the breath end on a growl .

“ What did [I]40-eli tell [you]40-eli this morning ? ”[40-eli] [he]40-eli asked , [his]40-eli voice lethal .

[[His]40-eli latest temporary personal assistant]229-sweetheart currently putting a massive cramp in [his]40-eli style blinked [her]229-sweetheart big , doelike eyes . “ Not to interrupt [you]40-eli , but , [Mr. Crane]41-reese — ”[229-sweetheart]

“ Not . To . Interrupt [me]40-eli . ”[40-eli] [He]40-eli made a show of pulling [his]40-eli shoulders straight and hobbling around the table . [Her]229-sweetheart gaze trickled down to the prosthesis at the end of [his]40-eli right leg as [he]40-eli affected a limp . One [he]40-eli did n’t have . One [he]40-eli ’d trained [himself]40-eli not to have .

The help found [him]40-eli more intimidating when reminded [he]40-eli was an amputee . [He]40-eli ’d used it to [his]40-eli advantage on more than one occasion . “ Do [I]40-eli look like [I]40-eli need to be bothered with trivial questions , [Melanie]42-melanie ? ”[40-eli]

“ N - no , [sir]40-eli , but it ’s about [Crane Hotels]40-eli and [I]40-eli was hired to — ”[40-eli]

“ [You]229-sweetheart answer to [me]40-eli , ”[40-eli] [he]40-eli told [her]229-sweetheart point - blank . “ [I]40-eli do n’t care if it ’s a memo from [the Pope]1768-the pope . [I]40-eli asked not to be interrupted . [I]40-eli expect not to be interrupted . ”[40-eli]

“ But the board meeting … ”[42-melanie] [Melanie]42-melanie trailed off , [her]229-sweetheart eyes blinking faster as if staving off tears .

Tough shit , [sweetheart]229-sweetheart .

The sooner word reached [[his]40-eli brothers]230-his brothers that the ninth — or was [Melanie]42-melanie the tenth?—PA to set foot in [[Eli]40-eli ’s warehouse]231-eli ’s warehouse left in tears , the better . [He]40-eli was n’t interested in resuming a position with [Crane Hotels]40-eli for a myriad of personal reasons , none of which [he]40-eli ’d shared with [them]232-them . [The thickheaded men in [[his]40-eli family]234-his family]233-the thickheaded men in his family did n’t listen when [he]40-eli ’d clearly and concisely said no to a pencil - pushing position at [[the Crane]235-the crane home base]236-the crane home base , so [he]40-eli ’d resorted to showing not telling . [The more assistants [Reese]41-reese]237-the more assistants reese had sent , the brasher [Eli]40-eli had become .

“ [Mr. Reese Crane]41-reese said all [you]1769-you need to do is read this report and give [your]1769-you opinion . [I]235-the crane can reiterate on the conference call for [you]1769-you , ”[235-the crane] [she]235-the crane squeaked .

[Eli]40-eli elevated [his]41-reese chin and stared [her]235-the crane down . [She]235-the crane did n’t hold [his]41-reese gaze , [hers]235-the crane jerking left then right and very purposefully avoiding dipping to [his]41-reese missing limb for a second time .

[She]42-melanie was about to be on the receiving end of [the not - so - nice guy [he]41-reese ’d become]238-the not - so - nice guy he ’d become .

“ [You]1770-you want [my]41-reese opinion ? [I]41-reese ’ll give [you]1770-you [my]41-reese opinion . ”[41-reese] [He]41-reese lashed a hand around [her]42-melanie wrist , removed the folder from [her]42-melanie hand , and tossed it into the fireplace . There were mostly embers now , but a single flame crawled over the edge of the folder as it slid onto the concrete floor . The fire fizzled , smoking instead of igniting .

Well . That was unimpressive .

“ [You]1770-you … [you’re]1770-you … ”[42-melanie] [Melanie]42-melanie ’s fists were balled at [her]42-melanie sides , [her]42-melanie eyes filling yet again as [she]42-melanie visibly shook .

“ Spit it out . [I]42-melanie do n’t have all day . ”[42-melanie]

“ [You]1770-you ’re [a monster]1771-a monster ! ”[42-melanie] [She]42-melanie turned and ran — yes , ran — from [[his]41-reese office]226-his office , through [[his]41-reese dining room]226-his office and to [the warehouse elevator]240-the warehouse elevator . [He]41-reese stepped out from behind [his]41-reese office wall to watch the entire scene , arms folded over [his]41-reese chest . There were few doors and walls in [this place]226-his office , so not much hampered the sight of another victory won by [Eli]40-eli “ Monster ”[40-eli] [Crane]40-eli .

Back in [[his]41-reese office]226-his office , [he]41-reese stomped on the smoking file folder at [his]41-reese feet . Once [he]41-reese was sure [he]41-reese would n’t burn down [[his]41-reese house]226-his office , [he]41-reese chucked the folder into the wastebasket at the side of [his]41-reese desk .

“ Sorry , [Reese]41-reese , ”[41-reese] [he]41-reese said to thin air . “ [You]41-reese ’ll have to manage without [me]41-reese . ”[41-reese]

[They]241-they ’d managed without [him]41-reese for the years [he]41-reese was stationed overseas . [[His]41-reese brothers]230-his brothers could put one foot in front of the next without [him]41-reese . [God]43-god knew being away had n’t improved [Eli]40-eli ’s ability to weigh in on financials .

But that ’s not why [they]230-his brothers wanted [him]41-reese [there]243-there . [Reese]41-reese and [Tag]308-tag , and [[their]230-his brothers father]244-dad , wanted [Eli]40-eli there because [they]230-his brothers believed [Crane Hotels]40-eli was part of [Eli]40-eli ’s future . A legacy , like [CEO]45-ceo was for [Reese]41-reese . Like Guest and [Restaurant Services]245-restaurant services was for [Tag]308-tag .

[Eli]40-eli ’s avoidance was in part because [he]41-reese had spearheaded a sizeable personal project and in larger part because wherever [he]41-reese went , unfortunate events unfurled . [He]41-reese was n’t quite ready to topple the company [[his]41-reese father]244-dad had grown into an empire .

[His]41-reese cell phone buzzed with a text from [an old friend [he]41-reese ’d contacted earlier this week]246-an old friend he ’d contacted earlier this week . [He]41-reese lifted the phone and walked smoothly from [his]41-reese desk to [the kitchen]247-the kitchen , reading the text .

Yep , still in business .

[He]41-reese tapped in a reply . Let ’s talk more next week . Give [me]0-i a choice of dates .

[He]41-reese pocketed [his]41-reese phone , feeling a charge shoot down [his]41-reese arms . Since [he]41-reese ’d come [home]248-home , [he]41-reese ’d been consumed with giving back . With changing the worlds of [men]249-men and [women who ’d made sacrifices]250-women who ’d made sacrifices . For [[their]250-women who ’d made sacrifices country]251-their country , for [[their]250-women who ’d made sacrifices families]252-their families . [Men]249-men and [women who ’d returned [home]248-home with less than [they]249-men had before [they]249-men left and were expected to drop back into the flow of things]254-women who ’d returned home with less than they had before they left and were expected to drop back into the flow of things .

[Penance]46-penance , [some]255-some might argue , for everything in [Eli]40-eli ’s past . [He]41-reese was n’t above admitting that evening the scales for [his]41-reese failures was a big part of what drove [his]41-reese actions now .

Which meant [he]41-reese had no interest in stepping in as [chief operations officer of [the gargantuan Crane Hotels]257-the gargantuan crane hotels]256-chief operations officer of the gargantuan crane hotels , no matter how many PAs [[his]41-reese oldest brother]258-his oldest brother sent over .

Keep ’em comin ’ .

[Eli]40-eli had become adept at running off [PAs]47-pas . In fact , [he]41-reese ’d become even more creative about the ways [he]41-reese could get [them]249-men to quit .

If poor [Melanie]42-melanie had [her]42-melanie way , [he]41-reese ’d reside in [a creepy mansion atop [a hill]260-a hill]259-a creepy mansion atop a hill . [The gossip rags]261-the gossip rags would murmur about [the beastly Crane brother]262-the beastly crane brother [no one]263-no one dared bother lest [they]261-the gossip rags suffer [his]262-the beastly crane brother wrath . [He]262-the beastly crane brother let out a dry laugh , amused by the bend of [his]262-the beastly crane brother thoughts .

After the year [he]262-the beastly crane brother ’d had , that sounded a lot like heaven .

The phone was ringing off the hook today , which normally would be a good sign . But the caller on hold sent [Isabella Sawyer]48-isabella ’s stomach on a one - way trip to [her]48-isabella toes .

“ [Isa]435-isa ? ”[264-her assistant] [[her]48-isabella assistant]264-her assistant called again from [her]48-isabella desk . “ Do [you]435-isa want [me]264-her assistant to take a message ? ”[264-her assistant]

“ No , [Chloe]50-chloe , [I]48-isabella ’ll take it . ”[48-isabella] [She]48-isabella did n’t want to take it , but [she]48-isabella ’d take it . [She]48-isabella shut [her]48-isabella office door and in the minimizing crack watched as [[her]48-isabella friend]48-isabella ’s face morphed into concern . [Isa]435-isa gave [Chloe]50-chloe a thumbs - up [she]435-isa did n’t quite feel . Lifting the handset of [her]50-chloe desk phone was like facing [a firing squad]265-a firing squad .

“ [Bobbie]51-bobbie , hello , ”[435-isa] [she]435-isa said to [[Reese Crane]41-reese ’s secretary]266-reese crane ’s secretary .

“ Hold for [Mr. Crane]41-reese , ”[51-bobbie] [Bobbie]51-bobbie clipped in [her]51-bobbie usual curt manner .

[She]51-bobbie ’d had similar conversations with [Reese]41-reese several times already . Nine other times , to be exact . One for [each of the personal assistants [she]51-bobbie ’d sent over to work with [[his]41-reese brother]268-his brother]267-each of the personal assistants she ’d sent over to work with his brother . “ [Isa]435-isa . Here [we]1772-we are again , ”[41-reese] came [Reese]41-reese ’s smooth voice .

And married . Not that [he]41-reese was [Isa]435-isa ’s type . Business guys in suits for [clients]271-clients , yes . “ Solve [my]41-reese problem . ”[41-reese] [Reese]41-reese ’s commanding tone brooked no argument , nor should it . “ [I]41-reese have a solution . Chapter 2

Instead of going [downstairs]358-downstairs to [[Sable Concierge]52-sable ’s offices]359-sable concierge ’s offices via [[her]59-rachel apartment]360-her apartment overhead , the next morning [Isabella]48-isabella drove to [[Elijah Crane]40-eli ’s warehouse downtown]239-this place . Chapter 6

Chapter 9

Mondays were for overachieving .

[Eli]40-eli loved the fresh possibility of the first morning of the workweek , unlike [most people who treasured [Garfield]160-garfield - style litanies about hating Mondays]993-most people who treasured garfield - style litanies about hating mondays . To [him]93-josh , a new week was a fresh start . A chance to make up for a week that did n’t go well or a weekend where [he]93-josh ’d indulged .

Or a weekend where [he]93-josh ’d been blown off .

[He]93-josh ’d wanted to indulge — to overindulge — over and over with [Isa]435-isa , but at [[her]435-isa apartment]360-her apartment [she]435-isa ’d balked . [The stairs]2062-the stairs . At [the Vancouver]20-the vancouver , [she]435-isa ’d rerouted [him]93-josh , and then at [[her]435-isa apartment]360-her apartment , [she]435-isa ’d given up on [him]93-josh . [She]435-isa ’d proven to [him]93-josh that [she]435-isa was a lot like [everyone else]424-everyone else — first by coddling [him]93-josh , then by feeling sorry for [him]93-josh .

The entire evening had left a sour taste in [his]93-josh mouth and a fresh ripple of loneliness swamped [him]93-josh when [he]93-josh ’d returned [home]248-home alone . [He]93-josh regretted getting swept up in the moment at dinner as much as [he]93-josh regretted driving back to [[his]93-josh place]796-his place without arguing with [her]435-isa further .

[He]93-josh was n’t a total pig . [He]93-josh would have understood if [she]435-isa balked because [she]435-isa ’d changed [her]435-isa mind or because [she]435-isa simply did n’t want to be intimate . [He]93-josh could n’t help thinking [she]435-isa ’d balked because [those stairs]999-those stairs acted as a reminder that [he]93-josh was different from who [she]435-isa was used to dealing with — a special case . [A man with a missing limb]1000-a man with a missing limb that [she]435-isa did n’t know how to accommodate .

Emasculating ? Yes . Frustrating ? Hell yes .

Today was [his]1000-a man with a missing limb clean slate — [Eli]40-eli could start over , get back into the swing of things . [Regimens]161-regimens were nothing knew . [He]93-josh was accustomed to following a routine . In [his]93-josh former life as [a Marine]1001-a marine , [his]93-josh days had been regimented . Once [he]93-josh ’d come [home]248-home , [his]93-josh days were regimented in a different way — organized by rehabilitation and relearning the basics like walking and how to care for and clean [his]93-josh wound . Now [he]93-josh worked out to maintain strength and muscle , ate a healthy amount of protein , veggies , and fruits , and focused on launching Refurbs for [Vets]142-vets .

[He]93-josh ’d learned repeatedly that life was anything but routine . Once [he]93-josh ’d found [a decent gallop]1003-a decent gallop , there ’d be a hiccup that temporarily set [him]93-josh back . Those hiccups paled in comparison to [the major upset of [Isa]435-isa]1006-the major upset of isa .

[The woman]228-merina was n’t a hiccup ; [she]228-merina was an attack — the kind requiring a rushed visit to [the hospital]772-the hospital for emergency surgery .

Today [he]93-josh was ready for [her]228-merina . [He]93-josh ’d been up since five this morning , had started with a protein shake and an aggressive workout that spent [his]93-josh muscles and left [him]93-josh panting and sweating on the mat in [his]93-josh exercise area .

Then it was shower , shave , prep [his]93-josh meals for the day . [He]93-josh was n’t going to have takeout lunch with [[his]93-josh assistant]1780-his assistant any longer . [He]93-josh ’d crossed more than one line with [her]228-merina . [He]93-josh blamed proximity and good old - fashioned lust . [Isabella]48-isabella was [a beautiful , beguiling , and intriguing woman]48-isabella . [His]41-reese heart .

Was [he]41-reese brave enough to give [Isa]435-isa every part of [him]41-reese ? Not yet , but maybe [he]41-reese could be in the future . That possibility intrigued and frightened [him]41-reese . That it existed at all was a miracle .
